When I was a dirt poor teen/youngadult, saving up for/during university, I worked double shifts making dough balls in a warehouse; it would take me 2.5 hours to cycle to work, I would then work for 16 hours then cycle home in 2.5 hours. I used to get in, shower,eat and be asleep in under 10 minutes.Then I would have just under 3 hours of sleep.
I did this for 6 days a week and basically spent every sunday recovering. I did this all summer long and during our other school breaks.
Looking back I don't know how I did it but honestly at the time I didn't think anything of it as I desperately needed the money.

At our company when people do have records, we always have a candid discussion to find out what happened and what they have done to get their life back together.
We had one guy who had spent 20 years in prison because he got home to find two men raping his wife and murdered them both with his bare hands.
He wasn't a violent man or a psycho, he just reacted in the moment to a devastating scenario.
He's been at the company for 10 years and he is an absolute star but soo many places instantly rejected him because he had a criminal record and didn't bother to find out what happened.
Too soon!
